# Arpeggio: add4 in E

## Brief Overview
An arpeggio is the playing of the individual notes of a chord in sequence rather than simultaneously. The E add4 arpeggio is a type of arpeggio that includes the notes E, G#, B, and A#, creating a rich and interesting sound. In this case, the added 4th note is A# (the A# note is enharmonically equivalent to Bb).

## Notes and Intervals
- E (root)
- G# (major third)
- B (perfect fifth)
- A#/Bb (added 4th)

Intervals relative to the root (E):
- Major 3rd (G#): 3 semitones
- Perfect 5th (B): 7 semitones
- Added 4th (A#/Bb): 6 semitones

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The E add4 arpeggio can be used in various music genres, including rock, pop, jazz, and fusion. It adds color and tension to a chord progression, providing a dreamy or ethereal quality to the music. This arpeggio can convey emotions ranging from introspective and contemplative to uplifting and hopeful, depending on how it is incorporated into the composition.
